<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[No! No! I Created You!](/Feats.aspx?ID=3047) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=16" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Inventor" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=408" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 25</row>

**Frequency**
once per minute

**Prerequisites**
[construct companion](/companions/construct-companions)

**Trigger**
Your construct companion would become [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5) or [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=6).

</column>

---

You appeal to your construct companion's bond with its creator to have it break free of a controlling effect. Attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the effect that confused or controlled your construct companion, using your [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) modifier for the counteract check and half your level rounded up for the counteract level.
name: No! No! I Created You!
